problem.markdown:
>>Which of the following types of loads would be classified as lateral or horizontal loads on a typical building? Check all that apply.<< [x] Wind [ ] Self-weight [ ] Traffic [x] Earthquakes [ ] Snow
[explanation] Wind and earthquake loads are typically classified as lateral or horizontal loads since the forces act horizontally (think about wind pushing on the side of a building). Earthquakes are a bit tougher to visualize but they also are typically classified as lateral forces since they cause shaking back and forth, which induce horizontal forces. Self-weight, traffic, and snow are usually classified as vertical loads since they act downward due to gravity. [explanation]
